data.title: JIM: THE JAMES FOLEY STORY
data.meta_description: Two years after American photojournalist James Foley went missing in Syria, the graphic video of his public execution served as the shocking introduction
data.text:
Two years after American photojournalist James Foley went missing in Syria, the graphic video of his public execution served as the shocking introduction of ISIS to the world. Unwilling to allow his childhood friend to be remembered only by his death, Brian Oakes celebrates Foleyâ€™s life through intimate, revealing interviews with family members and friends. Moving and compassionate, Jim explores what drove Foley to risk his own life in conflict zones, while also conveying how his dangerous work affected those left behind. Courtesy of HBO Documentary Films.

Director: Brian Oakes

Producer: George Kunhardt, Teddy Kunhardt, Eva Lipman

Cinematographer: Clair Popkin

Editor: Aleks Gezentsvey

Music: Dan Romer, Saul Simon MacWilliams, Osei Essed

Language: English

Country: USA

Year: 2016
